Internet of Things Solutions

Learn to collect sensor data with MQTT, Pico & Node-RED

See Curriculum

Course Overview

In this hands-on workshop, you’ll build a full IoT pipeline—from flashing MicroPython on a Pico to streaming temperature, humidity, water-quality or air-quality data over MQTT—and finally visualizing it in Node-RED dashboards. Perfect for educators and students eager to dive into real-world sensing.

What You’ll Learn

Pico Setup

Flash MicroPython & configure your board.

Sensor Interfacing

Read temperature, humidity, pH & gas sensors.

MQTT Messaging

Publish/subcribe with Mosquitto broker.

Node-RED Dashboards

Build real-time data visualizations.

Curriculum & Modules

Module 1: IoT & MQTT Fundamentals
  • • Overview of IoT architectures
  • • MQTT protocol & topics
  • • Installing & running Mosquitto broker
Module 2: Raspberry Pi Pico Setup
  • • Flashing MicroPython firmware
  • • Writing & uploading your first scripts
  • • Serial & Wi-Fi configuration
Module 3: Sensor Integration
  • • DHT11/22 for temperature & humidity
  • • pH & turbidity for water quality
  • • MQ-series for air quality
Module 4: Node-RED & Dashboards
  • • Installing & wiring MQTT nodes
  • • Designing interactive dashboards
  • • Alerting & data logging

Who This Is For

Perfect for STEM educators, students, and hobbyists wanting a practical introduction to IoT sensor networks.
